comment: I'm an English major and a professional writer. I made a B in her class and that was done with great effort. Shes not mean or difficult to get along with but when it comes to grading time you'd better batten down the hatches. I liked her a lot as a person, but as teacher not so much Her grading scale is nonexistent and steeped largely in preference

This professor is terrible! I am struggling in her class like no other professor. No rubric, just random grades. I have consistently made C's in her class. She claims that a "C" is a good grade. You pretty much have to be a god to make an A. Good luck. You need it!
Her class was difficult, especially because I am not good at writing. She refuses to look at your rough drafts. She is a very hard grader.

She is really nice in class, and if you ask her a question about a paper before it is due she will help you out. However, she tends to change her mind about what she wants in the paper. On several occasions I have gotten marked off on stuff she told me to write (format, grammar, everything). If you have an option of taking someone else, I would.

She is super nice in class; however, it is impossible to receive an A, unless you can figure out her unique/rare/etc grading style. About 80% earned a C or lower, and 20% earned a B. She doesn't use a rubric, just pulls your grade out of a black hole. The corrections she makes on your paper does not support your grade. I would not recommend.

In class she is nice and laid back so you think that she will not be grading too badly. But once everyone gets their grades back, there are a few B's with mostly C's. I think there were 2 A's the entire semester on our paper. She does not really say what you can do better to get a better grade on your next paper.
